entry.title: Isatou Nyang (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that after the Paralympics, Gambian athlete Isatou Nyang (pictured) continued to train at night, and during the day she would beg to support herself?

entry.title: Nun saget Dank und lobt den Herren (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that "Nun saget Dank und lobt den Herren", a 16th-century German hymn based on Psalm 118, was rewritten and shortened in the 20th century for a hymnal of the Swiss Reformed Church?

entry.title: Devon Powers (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Devon Powers argues in Writing the Record that 1960s counter-culture music journalists Richard Goldstein and Robert Christgau acted as public intellectuals despite working outside of academia?

entry.title: Menai Strait whitebeam (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the critically endangered Menai Strait whitebeam has a population of roughly 30 individuals?

entry.title: Headreach Island (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Headreach Island had 175 acres (71 ha) of farmland in 1923, but by 1974 was mostly marshland or underwater?

entry.title: Telok Ayer MRT station (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that a temporary two-lane viaduct was built along Cross Street to replace the closed lanes during the construction of Singapore's Telok Ayer MRT station?

entry.title: Thomas J. Hannon (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Thomas J. Hannon succeeded in having a playground in his neighborhood named after his mother?

entry.title: HMS Obdurate (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that British M-class destroyers such as HMS Obdurate were built to counter German ships that did not exist?
